title: Ronan Farrow says National Enquirer sent him messages 'aggressively soliciting dick pics'
text:
Ronan Farrow claims in his new book Catch and Kill that he was targeted by executives at American Media Inc while reporting on President Trump and Harvey Weinstein in a bid to kill his credibility.

He writes that the National Enquirer in particular began to target him, citing a story the tabloid ran about his pedophile uncle who is in prison for molesting two boys for close to a decade as an example.

Farrow says that he has never met that man, who is the brother of his mother Mia Farrow, which could explain why the Enquirer allegedly began to go after Farrow with more targeted and direct attacks.

Or, as Farrow describes, started hitting below the belt.

Scroll down for video

Below the belt: Ronan Farrow (above in 2017) claims that intermediaries working for American Media and the National Enquirer 'began sending messages aggressively soliciting dick pics'

'Shortly after [the uncle story], intermediaries began sending messages aggressively soliciting "dick pics,"' writes Ronan.

'When I failed to send any, the Enquirer published a complaint that I refused.'

Farrow claimed that Enquirer editor Dylan Howard also published any 'flirtatious' or 'frank' responses that Farrow sent these 'intermediaries.'

At the same time, he was asked to comment on 'fabricated yarns' that he claims were completely untrue.

Farrow cites one example 'implicating me and another journalist, who worked on a prominent story critical of AMI, in some sort of Brazilian sex romp.'

Farrow then notes: 'If only my life were so exciting.';

His boyfriend Jon Lovett was also tailed by photographers with Coleman-Rayner that had been hired by the Enquirer's then-parent company.

An employee even recalls Howard saying, 'We're gonna put a tail on Ronan's boyfriend.'

That did not go so well though, as Lovett's 'routine had been so boring the subcontractor surveilling him had given up.'

A spokesperson for American Media responded to these claims in a statement, saying: 'Mr. Farrow's narrative is driven by unsubstantiated allegations from questionable sources and while these stories may be dramatic, they are completely untrue.'

Farrow previously made this claim in February when Jeff Bezos shared information that suggested he was being balckmailed by American media editors.

Farrow commented at the time by tweeting: 'I and at least one other prominent journalist involved in breaking stories about the National Enquirer’s arrangement with Trump fielded similar “stop digging or we’ll ruin you” blackmail efforts from AMI. (I did not engage as I don’t cut deals with subjects of ongoing reporting.)'

Catch and Kill hits bookshelves on Tuesday.
description: Ronan Farrow writes that the National Enquirer  began to target him, citing a story about his pedophile uncle who is in prison for molesting two boys for close to a decade as an example.
